document.docAuthor: Aguiar, Alexandre Pires & Ramos, Adriana C. B.
document.docTitle: Digonocryptus arcaeus Aguiar et Ramos 2011, sp. nov.

heading.emphasis:
Digonocryptus arcaeus Aguiar et Ramos
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description .
Holotype FEMALE. Fore wing 11.7 mm .

Head. Ventral tooth of mandible longer than dorsal tooth. Clypeus apical area delimited by smooth border; clypeal margin with one tooth (as in Fig. 128 ). Antenna with 24 flagellomeres; white band starting at flagellomere IV; 11 flagellomeres at least 50% white.

Mesosoma
. Mesopleuron, mesepimeron and carinal triangle covered with dense white pilosity, most intense on mesepimeron; mesopleuron finely strigate. Subalar prominence large, suboval, not keeled. Sternaulus very deep, crenulated. Sulcus between sternaulus and scrobe weak. Posterior transverse carina of mesosternum imperfectly developed medially (as a wrinkle). Lower metapleuron densely pilose, entirely and very finely strigate-rugulose. Propodeum: area in front of anterior transverse carina mostly smooth, but with weak crenulation along carina, medially without ridges extending from carina towards anterior margin; area between anterior transverse carina and petiolar foramen covered with dense white pilosity, hairs longer than on metapleuron. Propodeal apophyses present as subtle scale-like structures, posterior transverse carina well developed and continuous with apophyses, but not developed beyond them. Area between anterior and posterior transverse carinae obliquely densely rugulose; area behind posterior carina transversely densely rugulose. Fore wing in Fig. 178 ; vein 3-Cu 1.32 length of 4-Cu. Hind wing in Fig. 218 .

Metasoma . Postpetiole medio-anteriorly with very weak subcircular concavity; dorsolateral and median dorsal carinae absent; petiolar spiracles in dorsal view not prominent. Ovipositor 1.27 length of hind tibia. Apex of lower valve apex with 11 teeth.

Color . Head and mesosoma main color black, both with pale yellow areas; metasoma mostly light orange. Lateral pattern as in Fig. 83 . Orbital band widely interrupted at malar space only; width on supra-antennal area and temple about 0.2 of interocular distance, covering most of gena ventral 0.4 but clearly not reaching occipital carina, narrowing towards dorsal part ( Fig. 83 ). Base of mandible yellow. Clypeus apical area, clypeal suture laterally and narrowly from parantennal impression to torulus, black; main area of clypeus, clypeal sulcus and entire supraclypeal area yellow. Mesosoma in Fig. 83 , with few, small yellow areas laterally; mesepimeron black but almost fully hidden by pilosity. Pronotum dorsally along anterior margin, almost reaching apex of lateral corner, with wide yellow stripe, not dorsally interrupted, widest and somewhat triangularly pointed at epomia; laterally on dorsal margin with long and regular yellow spot. Propleuron entirely black. Mesoscutum entirely black. Scutellum and postscutellum entirely yellow. Propodeum as in Figs 83–84 , entirely black. Fore coxa and trochanter pale yellow, coxa latero-apically with small brown streak; mid coxa mostly pale yellow, mesally and lateral apex light orange; hind coxa, trochanter, trochantellus and femur orange, coxa with small dorso-basal yellow spot; fore femur brownish; mid femur brownish yellow; fore tibia yellow, mid and hind tibia deep yellow; fore and mid tarsus gradually changing from t1 basally brownish yellow to t5 dark brown; hind t1–4 gradually changing from t1 basally deep yellow to t4 pale yellow; t5 basal 0.7 reddish brown, apex dark brown. Metasoma: T1 basal 0.3 and widely on apical margin, yellow, centrally dark brown; T2–8 entirely and uniformly light orange.

Comments .
Isolated from other species of the
D. diversicolor
complex mostly by having hind coxa dorsobasally with small yellow spot ( vs. absent or very large). Differs from
D. grenadensis (Ashmead)
by lacking black on hind coxa, trochanter and trochantellus, by having petiole basally yellow ( vs. fully black), T2 fully orange ( vs. mostly darkened and apically with interrupted yellow stripe) and scutellum of different shape, about as long as maximum width ( vs. length/maximum width near 1.6 on holotype ). The many flagellomeres forming the white band of the antenna is also characteristic of
D. arcaeus
.

Material examined .
17 females , 9 males . HOLOTYPE

Brazil ( AM , AP , GO , MT , PA , PR , RO), Peru , Surinam .
